snippet: More than half of the 1,300 residents of Sordevolo, a town in Piedmont, are involved in the production in one guise or another.
abstract: Sordevolo Journal; over half of 1,300 residents of village of Sordevolo in Italy's Piedmont region  participate in centuries old tradition, the amateur reenactment of The Passion of Christ, three times a week for the entire summer, every five years; production, which has gone on for generations is source of tremendous community pride, bringing tourists and boosting local economy.
lead_paragraph: More than half of the 1,300 residents of Sordevolo, a town in Piedmont, are involved in the production in one guise or another.

headline.print_headline: Passion Play Endures, and Italians Become More Than Merely Players
headline.main: Staging Passion Play for 200 Years, Italians Become More Than Merely Players
